content: Would it be an idea to add the build/vscache folder to the ignore list? It leads to a lot of pseudo changes.
no that would be bad idea indeed.
I'm still working on why it changes
Yes, it still changes, with fairly frequent tree conflicts for me, but not as much as it did in the past.

Committers: Josh and I had a long thread about the vscache files, which are potentially a problem once we start trying to merge on Git. In principle, there should be no merge conflicts in the vscache files, if, that is, you always build before committing any binding or value set changes, and everyone always commits any changes to vscache along with any other changes,
for now, if you get any conflicts in vscache, please let me know, and I'll investigate

So one thing we should be able to verify during our Travis CI run is... if you submit a PR, and we run the Travis build on your PR... the contents of vscache shouldn't change during this build. If they do, the build should fail. Is that correct @Grahame Grieve ?
I think it is. under the current rules that should be the case
Should I add this to our Travis build rules now?
yes, lets do that and see if it throws anything up
This means to all you commiters out there like me who have bad habits of not ever committing vscache is we got to change are lazy ways.
Does that mean we commit when the loinc and snomed files change too?

For what it's worth, I just got this:

Updated to revision 13036.
Summary of conflicts:

so you got that when - commit after build?
That was on updating to rev 13036 after a previously successful full build of 12986 - with no local changes made in between.
Ok let me know if you get more from here on in
